title: Brugada Criteria for Ventricular Tachycardia
desc: The Brugada Criteria diagnoses ventricular tachycardia on EKG.

orgreference.text: Brugada P, Brugada J, Mont L, Smeets J, Andries EW. A new approach to the differential diagnosis of a regular tachycardia with a wide QRS complex. Circulation. 1991;83(5):1649-59.

inputs.label_en: Absence of an RS complex in all precordial leads
inputs.name: absentcomplex
inputs.tips_en: All QRS complexes completely upright or completely downward in precordial leads

inputs.label_en: R to S interval >100 ms in one precordial lead
inputs.name: rsinterval
inputs.tips_en: Distance between R and S waves in each precordial lead

inputs.name: dissociation
inputs.tips_en: P waves seen at different rates than QRS complex

inputs.label_en: Morphology criteria for VT present in both precordial leads V1-2 and V6
inputs.name: morphology
inputs.tips_en: VT is frequently either in a right bundle branch block pattern (upright in V1) or a left bundle branch block pattern (downward in V1)
